headline.print_headline: U.S. Reins In Advice-Givers on Retirement
headline.main: ‘Customers First’ to Become the Law in Retirement Investing

snippet: The Labor Department, after years of battling Wall Street and the insurance industry, will require financial advisers and brokers to act in their clients’ best interests.
abstract: Labor Dept issues regulations governing how financial advisers and brokers manage individual retirement and 401(k) accounts, requiring them to act in best interests of their clients; brokers have to date only been required to recommend so-called suitable investments, which can allow them to push for funds that pay them higher commission; rules will likely spur shift of many retirement funds into lower-cost investments and could result in one of largest upheavals in industry in decades.
